title: India-Taliban talks: Region in flux and 5 reasons behind Delhi’s decision to engage Kabul - The Indian Express
summary:
India-Taliban Talks: Region in Flux and 5 Reasons Behind Delhi’s Decision to Engage Kabul

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The meeting between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi highlights India's approach to navigating complex geopolitical dynamics.

  • The meeting underscores India's national and security interests in the region.
  • No official recognition of the Taliban government is being considered yet.
  • Geopolitical shifts in the region are prompting India to engage cautiously.
  • India's humanitarian and development assistance to Afghanistan remains a facet of the discussions.
  • Ongoing concerns about Afghan security and its implications for India.
“This meeting is an effort by India to secure its own national and security interests with many moving parts in play.”

In conclusion, the talks signal India's strategic approach to a changing political landscape and reflect its ongoing commitment to Afghanistan amidst challenges.
newTitle: India-Taliban Talks: Reasons Behind Delhi’s Engagement with Kabul

Delhi election: Kejriwal offers to sponsor private guards hired by RWAs in latest poll perk - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Offers to Sponsor Private Guards Hired by RWAs in Latest Poll Perk

Published on January 10, 2025 by HT News Desk

The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has announced a new initiative aimed at securing support in the upcoming Delhi assembly elections by offering financial support for Resident Welfare Associations (RWAs) to hire private guards.

  • Arvind Kejriwal announced funding for private security for RWAs if AAP wins the elections.
  • This move is part of a broader strategy to counter anti-incumbency sentiments.
  • Additional welfare schemes announced include a ₹2,100 monthly honorarium for women and free healthcare for the elderly.
  • The elections will take place on February 5, with counting on February 8.
“It is a single-phase election... we have deliberately kept polling on a Wednesday so more people come out to vote,” – CEC Rajiv Kumar.

The upcoming election will be crucial for AAP as it seeks a third consecutive term amid increasing competition from BJP and Congress.
newTitle: Kejriwal Promises Security Perk for RWAs in Delhi Elections

title: BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 - SarkariExam.com
BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 - SarkariExam.com
BEL Probationary Engineer Online Form 2025 - SarkariExam.com
summary:
BEL Probationary Engineer Online Form 2025 Released

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Sarkari Result

Introduction: Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) has announced recruitment for 350 Probationary Engineer positions in Electronics and Mechanical disciplines.

Key Points:

  • Application process started on January 10, 2025.
  • Last date to apply is January 31, 2025.
  • Application fees are Rs. 1180 for General, EWS, OBC; no fee for SC, ST candidates.
  • Age limit: Maximum age of 25 years as of January 1, 2024.
  • A total of 350 posts are available (200 Electronics, 150 Mechanical).
  • Selection will be through a Computer-Based Test (CBT) and interviews.
"Candidates must have BE/B.Tech/B.Sc (Engineering) in Electronics or related disciplines to apply."

For more details, candidates can visit the official website of BEL.
newTitle: BEL Probationary Engineer Online Form 2025 Released

Bombay high court expresses concern over Mumbai AQI: ‘Phase out diesel vehicles, wood-fired bakeries’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bombay High Court Urges Phase-Out of Diesel Vehicles and Wood-Fired Bakeries to Combat Mumbai's Air Pollution

Date: November 9, 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Bombay High Court has expressed concerns over Mumbai's deteriorating air quality, recommending the phase-out of diesel vehicles and wood-fired bakeries to improve conditions.

  • The court is addressing the issue amid worsening air quality in the city.
  • Diesel vehicles and bakery bhattis are significant contributors to air pollution.
  • The bench highlighted the importance of CNG and electric vehicles as alternatives.
  • Senior advocate indicated bakery bhattis are the third-largest polluters in Mumbai.
  • The court questioned the administrative response to recurring pollution issues post-Diwali.
“What is the solution in such situations? All this starts every year after Diwali… so now what is the solution?”

The court's proactive suggestions aim to tackle the chronic air quality issues facing Mumbai, pushing for immediate actionable measures.
newTitle: Bombay High Court Urges Phase-Out of Diesel Vehicles and Wood-Fired Bakeries to Combat Mumbai's Air Pollution

IAS Officer from J&K posted Secretary Education in Telangana - Cross Town News
summary:
IAS Officer Yogita Rana Appointed Secretary Education in Telangana

Date: January 10, 2023 Source: Cross Town News

Yogita Rana, an IAS officer from Jammu and Kashmir, has been appointed as the Secretary of Education in Telangana.

  • Yogita Rana is a 2003 batch IAS officer.
  • Prior to her appointment, she served as Joint Secretary in the Department of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare at the Government of India.
  • She was recently repatriated to her parent cadre in Telangana.
“Yogita Rana, hailing from Jammu and Kashmir, enhances the educational leadership in Telangana.”

This appointment signifies a positive step for educational administration in Telangana, leveraging Rana's extensive experience in governmental roles.
newTitle: IAS Officer Yogita Rana Appointed Secretary Education in Telangana

title: Dense fog delays flights in Delhi, SpiceJet flyer slams 2-hour wait: ‘I have an infant in my lap’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Dense fog delays flights in Delhi, SpiceJet flyer slams 2-hour wait: ‘I have an infant in my lap’

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Dense fog at Delhi airport has led to flight delays, prompting criticism from a SpiceJet passenger who was made to wait for two hours on the tarmac.

  • Pratyush Rawat criticized SpiceJet for mismanagement, claiming passengers were boarded even though the flight was unlikely to take off due to fog.
  • Delhi experienced zero visibility conditions, leading to over 100 flight delays on the morning of January 10.
  • Rawat expressed frustration about the poor planning, especially while having an infant with him on the flight.
“Why board SG263 knowing dense fog delays were foreseeable? I have an infant in my lap, and this 2-hr flight has turned into a 6-hr ordeal.” - Pratyush Rawat

SpiceJet has acknowledged the inconvenience caused to passengers and suggested contacting them for further assistance, while the Delhi Airport issued advisories regarding the delays.
newTitle: Dense fog causes delays at Delhi Airport, SpiceJet passenger criticizes long wait

title: J&K: Chief Justice withdraws order regarding acceptance of FIRs & Challans manually - Cross Town News
Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones - The Indian Express
summary:
Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Indian Express

This year's Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj marks a significant technological advancement with the introduction of the Digi Kumbh initiative, aiming to enhance security and management through AI and digital tools.

  • The event is expected to attract around 40 crore pilgrims.
  • Over 2,750 CCTV cameras will ensure comprehensive surveillance.
  • AI technology is being utilized to track crowd movements effectively.
  • This initiative is considered the largest face recognition exercise in India.
“I have been playing bhajans (hymns) and taking photos on my phone. Since there is no Internet, I cannot use any of the Kumbh apps,” said Vijaypuri Bapu, a naga sadhu.

The digital transformation at Maha Kumbh Mela represents a blend of tradition and technology, aiming for a safer and more organized gathering for millions.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones

CBI books Karti Chidambaram in fresh corruption case - The Indian Express
summary:
CBI Investigates Karti Chidambaram in New Corruption Case

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The CBI has initiated a corruption investigation against Karti Chidambaram, a Congress MP, citing suspected fund transfers from Diageo and Sequoia Capital.

  • Karti Chidambaram is accused of receiving suspicious payments linked to liquor company Diageo and venture capital firm Sequoia Capital.
  • The investigation includes companies controlled by Karti and his associate, S Bhaskararaman.
  • The CBI's preliminary inquiry began in May 2018 amid allegations of improper FIPB approvals.
  • Notably, Diageo allegedly transferred $15,000 to influence public servants and bypass regulatory ban on their products.
  • Sequoia Capital's investments were scrutinized for suspicious share transactions linked to Karti.
“The enquiry revealed that Diageo Scotland used to import duty-free Johnnie Walker whisky and... had put an embargo on the sale of the Diageo Group’s duty-free products in India.”

This ongoing investigation highlights significant concerns regarding political corruption and regulatory manipulation within India's financial sectors.
newTitle: CBI Investigates Karti Chidambaram in New Corruption Case
